thread.title: Jays-Royals game leads to road closures in Toronto |
thread.title_full: Blue Jays-Royals game leads to road closures in Toronto | Toronto Star

author: Evelyn Kwong Staff Reporter
title: Jays-Royals game leads to road closures in Toronto |
text:
The Blue Jays rediscovered their swagger last night against the Kansas City Royals, leading them to a heated Game 4 of the American League Championship Series.
Temporary road closures at the end of the game will be in effect tonight to assist with the safety of motorists and pedestrians:
Blue Jays Way will have a partial road closure, for southbound traffic, from Front St. West to Navy Wharf
Bremner Blvd. will have a partial road closure, for eastbound traffic, from Spadina Ave.to Rees St.
Bremner Blvd. will have a full road closure, for eastbound traffic, from Rees St. to Lower Simcoe
Bremner Blvd. will have a full road closure, for westbound traffic, from Lower Simcoe to Navy Wharf
Police warn that there will traffic disruptions in the downtown core and encourage people to take public transit, and for those who are not attending the game to avoid the area.
